      static Node Chapter4.findLca(Node root, Node node1, Node node2)
      To find the least common ancestor (LCA) of two nodes in binary tree
      The logic is: If the two nodes are in different subtrees, then current node is the LCA
      Else move to the subtree where nodes are present.

      Helper function for Chapter4.printSumInBinaryTree(Node, int)
      This function prints the sum by keeping a list with current path.
      static void Chapter4.printSumInBinaryTree(Node root, int n)
      Problem 4.9: Given a binary tree, print all paths within the tree for which the sum equals a given number
      The strategy is to keep an list that keep track of the path till current node
      At each node, traverse in reverse and find if there are paths for which the sum equals given value.
